message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.CE 

This paper deals with the optimization of a cooperative non-orthogonal multiple access (Co-NOMA) scheme in hybrid visible light communication/radio-frequency (VLC/RF) systems. It involves the joint optimization of user pairing, link selection, and power allocation, which are typical topics in the information theory (cs.IT), networking and internet architecture (cs.NI), multimedia (cs.MM), control engineering (cs.SY), and computer engineering (cs.CE) sub-categories.
